qas.question: What was the first true engine that was commercially successful?
Who was the inventor of the atmospheric engine?
About what year was the atmospheric engine invented?
What was the first true vacuum that was commercially successful?
Who was the inventor of the vacuum?
About what year was the vacuum engine developed?
What was invented in a storage reservoir?

context: The first commercially successful true engine, in that it could generate power and transmit it to a machine, was <a0_3>the <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>atmospheric engine<b5_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, invented by <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><b6_0>Thomas Newcomen<b6_0/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> <a2_1>around <a2_0><a2_2><a2_3><b7_0>1712<b7_0/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. It was an improvement over Savery's <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><b8_0>steam pump<b8_0/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, using a piston as proposed by <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><b9_0>Papin<b9_0/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>. Newcomen's engine was relatively inefficient, and in most cases was used for pumping water. It worked by creating a partial vacuum by condensing steam under a piston within a cylinder. It was employed for draining mine workings at depths hitherto impossible, and also for providing a reusable water supply for driving waterwheels at factories sited away from a suitable "head". Water that had passed over the wheel was pumped back up into a storage reservoir above the wheel.
